member.name: T:Adobe.DocumentServices.PDFTools.io.FileRef
member.summary:
This class represents either a local file or a URL-based web page. It is typically used by implementations which accept or return files.
If a FileRef instance is created by this SDK and it refers to a temporary file location, calling any of the overloaded saveAs methods will delete the temporary file.

member.summary:
Creates a FileRef instance from a local file path where the media type can be inferred from the file extension.
To specify the media type explicitly, use .

member.summary:
Creates a FileRef instance from an input stream using the specified media type.
The Stream is not read by this method but by consumers of file content such as
member.param: Media type, to identify the file format

member.name: M:Adobe.DocumentServices.PDFTools.io.FileRef.SaveAs(System.String)
member.summary:
Saves this file to the location specified by targetLocation. If this FileRef instance refers to a temporary local file created by the SDK, that temporary file is deleted.
The directory mentioned in targetLocation is created if it does not exist.
member.exception: File already exists in the target location
Invalid sourceFile or destination file name
Does not have the required permission to move the file to a specified location
thrown when method SaveAs called on non operation results

member.name: M:Adobe.DocumentServices.PDFTools.io.FileRef.SaveAs(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary:
Writes the contents of this file to outputStream. If this FileRef instance refers to a temporary local file created by the SDK, that temporary file is deleted.
Note: This method does not close outputStream.
member.exception: An I/O error occurred.
Invalid sourceFile name
Does not have the required permission to delete the source file
thrown when method SaveAs called on non operation results

A successfully executed Operation instance should not be reused.

member.summary: Supported compression levels for

member.name: F:Adobe.DocumentServices.PDFTools.options.compresspdf.CompressionLevel.HIGH
member.summary: Reduces the file size of pdf by reducing resolution of the coloured and grayscale images above 100 dpi to 72 dpi (dots per inch). This option uses JPEG medium quality compression. Output pdf will not contain hidden layers, document structure, metadata, javascript, user properties and print settings.
member.value: Reduces the file size of pdf by reducing resolution of the coloured and grayscale images above 100 dpi to 72 dpi.

member.name: F:Adobe.DocumentServices.PDFTools.options.compresspdf.CompressionLevel.MEDIUM
member.summary: Reduces the file size of pdf by reducing resolution of the coloured and grayscale images above 200 dpi to 144 dpi (dots per inch). This option uses JP2K medium quality compression.
member.value: Reduces the file size of pdf by reducing resolution of the coloured and grayscale images above 200 dpi to 144 dpi.

member.name: F:Adobe.DocumentServices.PDFTools.options.compresspdf.CompressionLevel.LOW
member.summary: Reduces the file size of pdf by reducing resolution of the coloured and grayscale images above 250 dpi to 200 dpi (dots per inch). This option uses JP2K high quality compression.
member.value: Reduces the file size of pdf by reducing resolution of the coloured and grayscale images above 250 dpi to 200 dpi.

member.name: M:Adobe.DocumentServices.PDFTools.options.createpdf.CreatePDFFromHTMLOptions.Builder.WithDataToMerge(Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JObject)
member.summary:
Sets the data to be used by the javascript in the source html file to manipulate the HTML DOM before it gets converted to PDF. This mechanism is intended to be used to supply data that might otherwise be retrieved using ajax requests.
To make use of this mechanism, the source html file must include a script element such as:
<script src="./json.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
where json.js refers to the JSON data
And also Requires javascript in the source html file to make use of this JSON data to manipulate the HTML DOM.
member.returns: this Builder instance to add any additional parameters

member.name: T:Adobe.DocumentServices.PDFTools.pdfops.CreatePDFOperation
member.summary:
An operation that converts a non-PDF file to a PDF file. Some source formats may have associated conversion parameters which can be set in the method.
The supported source media types are listed here. The class can be used to map file extensions to their corresponding media types when creating FileRef instances for the source files.
image/bmp
application/msword
application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.document
image/gif
image/jpeg
image/png
application/vnd.ms-powerpoint
application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.presentationml.presentation
text/rtf
image/tiff
text/plain
application/vnd.ms-excel
application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet
application/zip (see "Special handling for HTML inputs" below)
Special handling for HTML inputs:
An HTML input can only be provided as local zip archive.
When creating the corresponding FileRef instance, the media type must be "application/zip" for the local zip archive. Zip archives must have the following structure:
The main HTML file must be named "index.html".
"index.html" must exist at the top level of zip archive, not in a folder.
Sample Layout:
html_files.zip |__index.html |__referenced_file_1.css |__referenced_file_2.jpeg |__subfolder_1 |_____referenced_file_3.jpeg

member.name: T:Adobe.DocumentServices.PDFTools.pdfops.ExportPDFOperation
member.summary:
An operation which exports a source PDF file to a supported format specified by
For the image target formats (JPEG and PNG), the resulting file is a ZIP archive containing one image per page of the source PDF file. Each image file name ends with "_<unpadded_page_index>". For example, a PDF file with 15 pages will generate 15 image files. The first file's name ends with "_1" and the last file's name ends with "_15".

member.name: T:Adobe.DocumentServices.PDFTools.pdfops.ProtectPDFOperation
member.summary:
An operation that is used for securing PDF document with password(s). The password(s) is used for encrypting the PDF document and setting the restriction on certain features like printing, editing and copying in the PDF document.
The supported algorithm for encrypting the PDF contents are listed here. The can be used to set the encryption algorithm.
AES-128
AES-256
For AES-128 encryption the password supports LATIN-I characters only. For AES-256 encryption the password supports Unicode character set.

member.summary: Simple interface that represent a logger.

member.name: M:Adobe.DocumentServices.PDFTools.Logging.ILog.Log(Adobe.DocumentServices.PDFTools.Logging.LogLevel,System.Func{System.String},System.Exception,System.Object[])
member.summary: Log a message the specified log level.
member.param: Optional format parameters for the message generated by the messagefunc.
member.returns: true if the message was logged. Otherwise false.
member.remarks: Note to implementers: the message func should not be called if the loglevel is not enabled so as not to incur performance penalties. To check IsEnabled call Log with only LogLevel and check the return value, no event will be written.

member.name: M:Adobe.DocumentServices.PDFTools.Logging.LogProviders.LogMessageFormatter.SimulateStructuredLogging(System.Func{System.String},System.Object[])
member.summary: Some logging frameworks support structured logging, such as serilog. This will allow you to add names to structured data in a format string: For example: Log("Log message to {user}", user). This only works with serilog, but as the user of LibLog, you don't know if serilog is actually used. So, this class simulates that. it will replace any text in {curly braces} with an index number. "Log {message} to {user}" would turn into => "Log {0} to {1}". Then the format parameters are handled using regular .net string.Format.
